powergrid.plugins

Class PowerGridPlugin

  • java.lang.Object
    • powergrid.plugins.PowerGridPlugin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Plugin

    public class PowerGridPlugin
extends java.lang.Object
implements Plugin
    This class acts as the container for the PowerGrid publicly accessible tasks.

    It provides the standard PowerGrid tasks in the same way as external plugins, meaning they can be handled in the same way.

    The publicly accessible tasks that this plugin provides are RestTask, TravelTask, and TravelNearestTask.

      • PowerGridPlugin

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
        Description copied from interface: Plugin
        This method is executed when the plugin is loaded.

        PowerGrid loads available plugins at startup. Therefore, to prevent long startup times, try to execute only small amounts of code here.

        Code executed in this method is not restricted by RSBot's SecurityManager. Also, since this method is executed before RSBot loads, some RSBot classes and methods might not work as expected.

        Specified by:
        setUp in interface Plugin

      • onLoad

        public void onLoad()
        Description copied from interface: Plugin
        This method is executed when RSBot has loaded.

        This guarantees that RSBot classes are correctly initialized, but it also means that code executed in this method is restricted by RSBot's SecurityManager.

        Specified by:
        onLoad in interface Plugin

      • getPublicTasks

        public java.util.Collection<java.lang.Class<? extends Task>> getPublicTasks()
        Description copied from interface: Plugin
        This method is executed by PowerGrid after the setUp() and onLoad() methods have been called.

        PowerGrid expects a Collection of Tasks that should be provided to the end-user as runnable tasks.

        Specified by:
        getPublicTasks in interface Plugin
        Returns:
        a Collection of the tasks that PowerGrid is allowed to provide to the user

      • tearDown

        public void tearDown()
        Description copied from interface: Plugin
        This method is called when PowerGrid unloads and RSBot shuts down.

        This is also the last chance for the plugin to save data, close streams and sockets, or clean up any other Objects that need proper finalization.

        Code executed in this method is restricted by RSBot's SecurityManager

        Specified by:
        tearDown in interface Plugin
